module.name: Growth Chart Module
module.author: Rita Cuckovich
module.description: Chart for pediatric patients to measure height, weight, and age against norms.

globalProperty.description: TSV giving the standard curves to be plotted for males. The first row consists of labels for the series. The first column should be the month in question, and the subsequent columns should be weights in kilograms.

TSV giving the standard curves to be plotted for females. The first row consists of labels for the series. The first column should be the month in question, and the subsequent columns should be weights in kilograms.

TSV giving the standard curves to be plotted for males. The first row consists of labels for the series. The first column should be the month in question, and the subsequent columns should be weights in kilograms.

TSV giving the standard curves to be plotted for females. The first row consists of labels for the series. The first column should be the month in question, and the subsequent columns should be weights in kilograms.

TSV giving the standard curves to be plotted for males. The first row consists of labels for the series. The first column should be the month in question, and the subsequent columns should be height in centimeters.

TSV giving the standard curves to be plotted for females. The first row consists of labels for the series. The first column should be the month in question, and the subsequent columns should be height in centimeters.

TSV giving the standard curves to be plotted for males. The first row consists of labels for the series. The first column should be the month in question, and the subsequent columns should be height in centimeters.

TSV giving the standard curves to be plotted for females. The first row consists of labels for the series. The first column should be the month in question, and the subsequent columns should be height in centimeters.
If the patient is older than this number of years, then don't display the chart.
How many pixels wide to make the graph
How many pixels high to make the graph
EncounterType associated with physician entered information
